alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Richmond and southeastern Essex Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dunnsville, or near Tappahannock. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tappahannock, Warsaw, Sharps, Farnham, Haynesville, Dunnsville, Wellford, Ethel, Village, Bowlers Wharf, Tidewater, Lyells, Kennard, Emmerton and Piney Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
